title: Strongest monster

properties.name: description
properties.value: The strongest monster in Old School RuneScape in terms of bosses and all monsters (based on combat level) is currently Verzik Vitur with a combat level of 1520. The strongest quest monster is currently Galvek, with a combat level of 608.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Strongest monster
Verzik Vitur, currently the strongest monster in Old School RuneScape.

The strongest monster in Old School RuneScape in terms of bosses and all monsters (based on combat level) is currently Verzik Vitur with a combat level of 1520. The strongest quest monster is currently Galvek, with a combat level of 608.

Contents

  • 1 Past record holders
    • 1.1 Overall strongest monster past record holders
    • 1.2 Historical strongest monster past record holders
    • 1.3 Excluded
    • 1.4 Overall quest monster past record holders
    • 1.5 Historical quest monster past record holders
  • 2 Top 30 strongest monsters
  • 3 See also

Past record holders[edit | edit source]

For more information on the monsters, please see their individual pages by clicking on the links below.

Overall strongest monster past record holders[edit | edit source]

Monster Level Timeframe Duration
Verzik Vitur (phase 3) 1520 7 June 2018–present 1414 days
TzKal-Zuk 1400 1 June 2017–7 June 2018 371 days
Great Olm 1043 5 January 2017–1 June 2017 147 days
Corporeal Beast 785 16 October 2014–5 January 2017 812 days
TzTok-Jad 702 22 February 2013–16 October 2014 601 days

Historical strongest monster past record holders[edit | edit source]

Note: This section refers to the historical context of the monsters upon their first incarnation into RuneScape.

Monster Level Timeframe Duration
Corporeal Beast 785 15 September 2008–10 January 2011 847 days
TzTok-Jad 702 4 October 2005–15 September 2008 1077 days
Kalphite Queen 333 7 September 2004–4 October 2005 392 days
King Black Dragon 245 (RSC) / 276 (RS2) 24 September 2002–7 September 2004 714 days
Black dragon 200 (RSC) 27 February 2002–24 September 2002 209 days
Elvarg 110 (RSC) 23 September 2001–27 February 2002 157 days
Greater demon 87 (RSC) 13 August 2001–23 September 2001 41 days
Lesser demon 79 (RSC) 11 June 2001–13 August 2001 63 days
Ice giant 68 (RSC) 6 April 2001–11 June 2001 66 days
Moss giant 62 (RSC) 5 February 2001–6 April 2001 60 days
Black Knight 46 (RSC) 4 January 2001–5 February 2001 32 days

Excluded[edit | edit source]

These characters were the strongest at the time, but are excluded from the main list due to being unattackable or inaccessible.

Monster Level Timeframe Duration
Combat Test 12743 6 May 2016–present 2176 days
Guard (Deadman Mode) 1337 22 October 2015–6 May 2016 196 days
Arzinian Being of Bordanzan 781 3 April 2014–16 October 2014 196 days
Zaros 9001 1 April 2014–3 April 2014 3 days
Arzinian Being of Bordanzan 781 21 March 2005–1 April 2014 3298 days
Hazeel 296 29 March 2004–14 September 2004 169 days

Overall quest monster past record holders[edit | edit source]

Monster Level Timeframe Duration
Galvek 608 4 January 2018–present 1,568 days
Glough 378 6 May 2016–4 January 2018 608 days
The Inadequacy 343 22 February 2013–6 May 2016 1169 days

Historical quest monster past record holders[edit | edit source]

Note: This section refers to the historical context of the quest monsters upon their first incarnation into RuneScape.

Monster Level Timeframe Duration
The Inadequacy 343 15 May 2007–26 November 2008 561 days
Black dragon (Freeing Sir Amik Varze) 227 15 March 2006–15 May 2007 426 days
Jungle demon 195 6 December 2004–15 March 2006 464 days
Nezikchened 187 (RSC) 20 August 2003–6 December 2004 473 days
Black demon (The Grand Tree) 175 (RSC) 12 September 2002–20 August 2003 342 days
Chronozon 121 (RSC) 9 April 2002–12 September 2002 156 days
Elvarg 110 (RSC) 23 September 2001–9 April 2002 198 days
Count Draynor 43 (RSC) 28 January 2001–23 September 2001 238 days
Delrith 30 (RSC) 4 January 2001–28 January 2001 24 days
